content: विधुर {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [विगता धूर्यस्य अच् समा°] {@--1@} Distressed, troubled, afflicted, overwhelmed with grief, miserable; <ls>Māl. 2. 3</ls>, <ls n="Māl.">9. 11</ls>, <ls>U. 3. 38</ls>, <ls n="U.">6. 41</ls>, <ls>Ki. 11. 26</ls>; <ls>Śi. 9. 77</ls>, <ls n="Śi.">17. 66</ls>, <ls>Bh. 3. 8</ls>, <ls n="Bh. 3.">114.</ls> {@--2@} Love-lorn, bereaved, suffering separation from a wife or husband; मयि च विधुरे भावः कांताप्रवृत्तिपराङ्मुखः <ls>V. 4. 20</ls>; विधुरां ज्वलनातिसर्जनान्ननु मां प्रापय पत्युरंतिकं <ls>Ku. 4. 32</ls>; विधुरबंधुरबंधुरमैक्षत <ls>Śi. 6. 29</ls>, <ls n="Śi.">12. 8.</ls> {@--3@} Devoid, deprived, or destitute of, free from; सा बै कलंकविधुरा मधुराननश्रीः <ls>Bv. 2. 5.</ls> {@--4@} Adverse, hostile, unfriendly; <ls>Pt. 2. 81.</ls> --रः A widower. --रं {@--1@} Alarm, fear, anxiety. {@--2@} Separation from a wife or husband, bereavement suffered by a lover or mistress.
